description: A list is a sequence of one or more list items of the same type. The list items may be separated by any number of blank lines.

cases.reason: Changing the bullet or ordered list delimiter starts a new list
Changing the bullet or ordered list delimiter starts a new list
In CommonMark, a list can interrupt a paragraph. That is, no blank line is needed to separate a paragraph from a following list

cases.content:
The number of windows in my house is
14.  The number of doors is 6.
cases.expectedHtml: The number of windows in my house is 14. The number of doors is 6.
cases.reason: In order to solve of unwanted lists in paragraphs with hard-wrapped numerals, we allow only lists starting with 1 to interrupt paragraphs. Thus,

cases.content:
The number of windows in my house is
1.  The number of doors is 6.
cases.expectedHtml:
The number of windows in my house is

  1. The number of doors is 6.
cases.reason: We may still get an unintended result in cases like
There can be any number of blank lines between items
There can be any number of blank lines between items

cases.content:
- a
 - b
  - c
   - d
  - e
 - f
- g
cases.reason: List items need not be indented to the same level. The following list items will be treated as items at the same list level, since none is indented enough to belong to the previous list item
List items need not be indented to the same level. The following list items will be treated as items at the same list level, since none is indented enough to belong to the previous list item
Note, however, that list items may not be indented more than three spaces. Here - e is treated as a paragraph continuation line, because it is indented more than three spaces
This is a loose list, because there is a blank line between two of the list items
So is this, with a empty second item
These are loose lists, even though there is no space between the items, because one of the items directly contains two block-level elements with a blank line between them
This is a tight list, because the blank line is between two paragraphs of a sublist. So the sublist is loose while the outer list is tight
Here the outer list is loose, the inner list tight

cases.content:
- a
  - b
  - c

- d
  - e
  - f
cases.reason: Here the outer list is loose, the inner list tight
